div1.p: In the District Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division
In the matter of the Petition of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiura, alias B.K. Sugiura, aliens, for Writ of Habeas Corpus | #2628 Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus

Upon reading and filing the petition of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiura, alias B.K. Sugiura, aliens, duly signed and verified whereby it appears that said petitioners are illiegally imprisioned and restrained of their liberty by Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration, at the City of Seattle, in King County, State of Washington, and stating wherein the illegality consists from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus out to issue:

It is therefore ordered and adjudged that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the the seal of this Court, directed to said Henry M. White, commanding him to have the bodies of said Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiura, alias B.K. Sugiura, aliens, before me in the Court Room of the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, sitting at Seattle, on the 16th day of December, A.D. 1913, at 10 o'clock in the forenoon of said day, and that day to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the petitioners, together with the time and cause of their detention; and that he have then and there, the said Writ.
Done in open court this 12 day of December, A.D. 1913, by the Court.
In the District Court for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
In the matter of the Petition of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiura, alias B.K. Sugiura, aliens, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Order granting writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division Dec 12 1913 Frank L. Crosby By Deputy.
R. W. McClellan, H.A.P. Myers & Walter L. Johnstone attorney for Petitioners 805 Leary & 1158 Empire Building
Service of within Order and receipt of copy admitted this Elventh day of December 1913 Clay Allen Attorney for
